intro: Stenorrhynchos michuacanum subsp. vexillaris, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico. It is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in areas with well-drained soil. It produces showy blooms during the spring and summer months, making it a notable ornamental species. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other members of the Stenorrhynchos genus.
